channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped Infront of 133 cricklewood Broadway, 11th January
item.description:
Dumped Infront of 133 cricklewood Broadway please investigate and clear

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricklewood Broadway, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Bollard to stop cars has been removed, 11th January
item.description:
Someone keeps removing the bollard so they can drive their car through on Bagshot Street outside Amigos restaurant. A neighbour was threatened when he tried to replace it. It needs a way to keep it securely in place so it can’t be removed again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Bagshot Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle?, 11th January
item.description:
This car has not been moved in months and has been there so long it has green algae growing on it. We have been unable to find out who it belongs to. If it's not someone in the road we assume it must have been abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coleridge Walk, Temple Fortune, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dip in the road, 11th January
item.description:
Large dip in the road causing damage to cars and accidents as drivers trying to avoid it. The dip is highly uneven and affects traffic too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Herne Hill Road, Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, inadequate roads, 11th January
item.description:
These potholes are notorious and cover the whole stretch of road. The council need to resurface the whole of the road, not patchwork quilt it. This road has never had a smooth surface. Its dangerous and damages cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins on Broke Walk, 11th January
item.description:
Some of the recycling bins are turned so that they can't be fully opened, so residents can't fit their bags in the slot provided. Suggest turning all bins so that you can fully open the lid so that at least people can fit their rubbish in.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broke Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot Hole, 11th January
item.description:
The pot hole is causing traffic to stray into opposite carriage way at junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telegraph Path, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of furniture, electronics - happens regularly, 11th January
item.description:
Every week there are mattresses, shelving units and electronic items disposed at this point in the estate. The bins don't have lids so that can also cause issues.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broke Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 94.camden st, 11th January
item.description:
The manhole is sunken about 50mm below pavement level as a temp measure we have filled with sand a cement screed but belive it needs raising
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Georgiana Street, Kentish Town, Greater London

item.title: Bins constantly left on pavement, 11th January
item.description:
My neighbor constantly keeps leaving her bin full outside her house when she has adequate space within her gates (she created the space herself). Th8s is not only smelly but an obstruction on the pavement, especially for disabled and wheelchair users.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lightings on the road. the bridge and stairs are pitch black, 11th January
item.description:
All the lights around the flyover bridge are off. it’s all pitch black when crossing the bridge. It’s been months like this. Are you finally going to act?? This situation is not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
